title: XPC International
desc: During my 2nd trimester at University, I had a Group Project module where groups had to take on real client work. My group chose Vince and his company 'XPC International'.
work: My input on this project was to co-develop the website with another member of my group. We used React for the front-end development and Express / Node for the backend, using MongoDB as the database.

title: ThriveWise
desc: Sarah from ThriveWise was Ultroniq's first client. Sarah approached City of Glasgow College with her idea for her company and we were asked if we wanted to take on this project which we happily accepted.
work: I was involved little for the first iteration of the website but I was involved heavily in the re-design and development of ThriveWise. I was mainly in charge of taking the design for pages and make it a reality using WordPress and Divi.

title: AWT
desc: My first project at my time at university was for my 'Advanced Web Technologies (AWT)' module, I had to create a website using python and flask. We had a simple brief that let me decided most of the function and design of the website.
work: I had chosen to make my site similar to stack overflow, users would create an account and use the forums to post questions and receive answers via a comment section.

title: DVI
desc: One of the last modules I had at university was 'Designing the Visual Interface (DVI)'. Half of the modules mark came from the practical side where I had to create a website for a fictional company.
work: The website was for 'JusJax' a company that sold healthy snack bars. The site was a simple 1-page static site, I had complete control over the design and any functionality of the site. I mainly used React for this project.
